definition: to know
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
Heaven knows!

sentences.english: As with the Wal-Mart dream, I know better.
sentences.chinese: 就像誰人沃爾瑪的夢那樣，我就曉得。

sentences.english: Do you know a good optician ?
You know, councillor, the Manx parliament.
sentences.chinese: 您曉得，參議員，是曼克斯議會。

sentences.english: Nan fung also see oneself are na li lady's daughter.
sentences.chinese: 楠鳳也曉得了本人是娜麗夫人的女兒。

sentences.english: I don't know why the driver keeps riding on the  horn.
sentences.chinese: 我不曉得他爲什麼一直按喇叭。

sentences.english: He will eat curds and honey when he knows enough to reject the wrong and choose the right.
sentences.chinese: 到他曉得棄惡擇善的時候，他必喫奶油與蜂蜜。

sentences.english: JiangYu know all the culprit is the father CuiZhong tragedy of pain unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 江宇曉得一切悲劇的元兇是父親崔鍾達後痛苦不已。

sentences.english: Monica know is in trouble imelda, want to give her back to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 莫尼卡曉得是伊梅爾達在背後搗亂，想向她妥協。

sentences.english: I don't know what hit me.
sentences.chinese: 不曉得我撞了哪門子邪。

sentences.english: I don't know why the driver keeps blowing the horn.
sentences.chinese: 我不曉得他爲什麼一直按喇叭。

sentences.english: Then wed have some ideas of what youll be needing.
sentences.chinese: 那麼我們就會意中有點兒數，曉得你們需求什麼了。

sentences.english: Natasha, getting up and curtseying, did not know either what she was to do.
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎站起來，行屈膝禮，她也不曉得應該怎麼辦。

sentences.english: He turns all his attention on me and lets me know I am important to him.
sentences.chinese: 祂會全神專注於我，讓我曉得祂重視我。

sentences.english: Don't know why HuiZhen curator of the position of the induction of proud fast.
sentences.chinese: 不曉得緣由的惠珍對館長高傲的立場感應不快。

sentences.english: Lang did not know a thing, getting a bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 不曉得啷個回事，脾氣變得越來越壞。

sentences.english: Tell me what you do not know whether to feel good like it?
sentences.chinese: 不曉得各位看官是否覺得這樣的不錯呢？

definition: to seem/to appear/(in a negative or interrogative sentence) to be sure
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
God knows.../Who would have imagined...?
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
as for/when it comes to
to remember

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
at that time
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
you (plural)
